chapter.title: What is &lj;?
chapter.para: &lj; is an open source content management system, written mainly in Perl and utilizing &mysql; as a database backend. By itself, it serves as a powerful content updating system. In other uses, it is the framework application behind many successful online communities, including &ljcomweb; and DeadJournal.com.

Under the employ of &ljcom;, &lj; was presented two People's Voice Awards from the The International Academy of Digital Arts and Sciences, one each for Personal Web Site and Service, during the 5th Annual Webby Awards. &lj; had further success when they were presented with the People's Voice Award in the Community category, in the 8th Annual Webby Awards.
